original: anyeṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ sitātapatramahoṣṇīṣamahāpratyaṅgirāvidyānubhāvena yāvad dvādaśayojanābhyantareṇa pañcāśatayojanābhyantareṇa vā vidyābandhaṃ karomi tejobandhanaṃ karomi sarvavidyābandhanaṃ karomi paravidyābandhanaṃ karomi sīmābandhanaṃ karomi dharaṇībandhanaṃ karomi daśadigbandhanaṃ karomi parasainyastambhanaṃ karomi /
analyzed: anyeṣām sarveṣām sita ātapatra mahā uṣṇīṣa mahā pratyaṅgirā vidyā anubhāvena yāvat dvādaśa yojana abhyantareṇa pañcāśata yojana abhyantareṇa vā vidyā bandham karomi tejaḥ bandhanam karomi sarva vidyā bandhanam karomi para vidyā bandhanam karomi sīmā bandhanam karomi dharaṇī bandhanam karomi daśa diś bandhanam karomi para sainya stambhanam karomi
translated: By the power of the knowledge of the great white parasol, the great ushnisha, and the great pratyangira, I bind the vidya up to twelve yojanas or five hundred yojanas away. I bind with splendor, I bind all vidyas, I bind other vidyas, I bind the boundaries, I bind the earth, I bind the ten directions, I paralyze the armies of others.

original: tadyathā om anane khakhane vīṣama vīre maunya śānte dānte vajradhara bandhabandhani vajrapāṇe phaṭ /
analyzed: tat yathā om anane khakhane vīṣama vīre maunya śānte dānte vajradhara bandha bandhani vajrapāṇe phaṭ
translated: Thus: Om Anane Khkhanane Vishma Vireshma Mooniya Shanti Danthe Vajradhare Bandha Bandhani Vajrapani Phat.
Om Hrum Shrom Phat Svaha.

original: om vajrapāśe bandha vajrapāśaṃ ca sarvaduṣṭavighnavināyakān hū phaṭ rakṣa māṃ sarvasattvāṃśca svāhā /
analyzed: om vajrapāśe bandha vajrapāśam ca sarva duṣṭa vighna vināyakān hū phaṭ rakṣa mām sarva sattvān ca svāhā
translated: Om Vajra-Pashe Bandha Vajra-Pasham Cha Sarva-Dusht-Vighna-Vinayakaan Hrum Phat Raksha Mama Sarva-Sattvashcha Svaha.

original: ya imāṃ sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣasitātapatrānāmāparājitāpratyaṅgirāmahāvidyārājñīṃ likhitvā bhūrjapatre vastre vā valkale vā kāyagataṃ vā kaṇṭhagataṃ vā kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati vāciṣyati aśuddhakaṃ na kṣamiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imām sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatra ānāma āparājitā pratyaṅgirā mahāvidyā rājñīm likhitvā bhūrja patre vastre vā valkale vā kāya gatam vā kaṇṭha gatam vā kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati vāciṣyati aśuddhakam na kṣamiṣyati
translated: Whoever writes this Aparajita, the great vidya-raja mantra of the ushnisha of all tathagatas, on birch bark, cloth, or bark, and wears it on their body or neck, will not be harmed by impure things,
will not be affected by any action,
will not be affected by any city,
will not be affected by any yoga,
will not die an untimely death,

original: sarvagrahāṇāṃ sarvavighnavināyakānāṃ ca priyo bhaviṣyati /🔽manaāpaścaturaśītikalpakoṭīsahasrāṇi jātau jātau jātismaro bhaviṣyati caturaśītivajrakulakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi vidyādevatā nityaṃ satatasamitaṃ tasya rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva grahāṇām sarva vighna vināyakānām ca priyaḥ bhaviṣyati  manaāpaḥ caturaśīti kalpa koṭī sahasrāṇi jātau jātau jātismaraḥ bhaviṣyati caturaśīti vajra kula koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi vidyādevatāḥ nityam satata samitam tasya rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim kariṣyanti
translated: will be loved by all the grahas and all the vighnas and vinayakas,🔽and will be born with a pleasant appearance for 84,000 kotis of kalpas. He will be protected, guarded, and concealed by 84,000 kotis of vidya-devas.

original: caturaśītivajradūtī kiṃkarā nityaṃ paripālayiṣyanti teṣāmapi priyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: caturaśīti vajradūtī kiṃkarāḥ nityam paripālayiṣyanti teṣām api priyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The 84,000 vajra messengers will always protect him and he will be loved by them.

original: manaāpaśca na kadācidyakṣatvaṃ na rākṣasatvaṃ na bhūtatvaṃ na piśācatvaṃ na pūtanatvaṃ na kaṭapūtanatvaṃ na manuṣyadāridryaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyati
analyzed: manaāpaḥ ca na kadācid yakṣa tvam na rākṣasa tvam na bhūta tvam na piśāca tvam na pūtana tvam na kaṭapūtana tvam na manuṣya dāridryam pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: He will never experience the state of being a yakṣa, a rākṣasa, a bhūta, a piśāca, a pūtana, a kaṭapūtana, or the poverty of a human.

original: gaṅgānadībālukāsaṃkhyeyāprameyāṇāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ puṇyaskandhena samanvāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī bālukā saṃkhyeya aprameyāṇām buddhānām bhagavatām puṇya skandhena samanvāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be endowed with the merit-aggregate of as many Buddhas as there are sands in the Ganges, immeasurable and innumerable.

original: imāṃ ca sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣasitātapatrānāmāparājitāṃ pratyaṅgirāṃ mahavidyārājñīṃ dhārayamāṇa abrahmacārī brahmacārī bhaviṣyati /🔽amaunī maunī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: imām ca sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatrā anām āparājitām pratyaṅgirām maha vidyā rājñīm dhārayamāṇa a brahmacārī brahmacārī bhaviṣyati  amaunī maunī bhaviṣyati
translated: And he who possesses this Aparājitā Mahāvidyārājñī, the Sitātapatrā of all Tathāgatas, the Aparājitā Pratyāṅgirā, will be celibate even if he is not celibate.🔽He will be silent even if he is not silent.
He will be pure even if he is impure.
He will observe the fast even if he does not observe the fast.

original: yo'pi pañcānantaryakārī syāt so'pi nirdhūtapāpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ api pañca ānantarya kārī syāt saḥ api nirdhūta pāpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Even one who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution will be free from sin.

analyzed: pūrva karma āvaraṇam niravaśeṣam parikṣayam gacchati
translated: The previous karmic obscurations will be completely exhausted.

original: yaḥ kaścit mātṛgrāme tathāgatoṣṇīṣasitātapatrānāmāparājitā mahāpratyaṅgirā mahāvidyārājñīṃ dhārayamāṇaḥ putrārthī putraṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid mātṛgrāme tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatrā nāma aparājitā mahāpratyaṅgirāḥ mahāvidyārājñīm dhārayamāṇaḥ putra arthī putram pratilabhate
translated: Any woman who possesses the Aparājitā Mahāvidyārājñī, the Sitātapatrā of the Tathāgatas, the Mahāpratyāṅgirā, who desires a son will obtain a son.
One attains the power of long life and merit.
After passing away from here, one is reborn in the world system Sukhavati.

analyzed: sa ca rāga dveṣa moha māna darpa vigataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And one will be free from passion, hatred, delusion, pride, and arrogance.

original: yaḥ kaścinmanuṣyamāre paśumāre gomāre sarve'pyupadravopasargopāyāsaparacakrāgamaneṣu tasya bhagavato jinasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣasitātapatrānāmāparājitāṃ dhvajāgrāvaropitāṃ kṛtvā mahatā pūjāsatkāreṇa mahatīṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā sarvanagaradvāreṣu praveśayet vihāre vā grāme vā nagare vā janapade vā nigame vā śmaśāne vā parvate vā araṇyāyatane vā imāmaparājitāṃ pratyaṅgirāṃ vidyārājñīṃ mahatā satkāreṇa praveśayet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid manuṣya māre paśu māre go māre sarvaḥ api upadrava upasarga upāyāsa para cakra āgamaneṣu tasya bhagavataḥ jinasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatrāṇām āparājitām dhvaja agra avaropitām kṛtvā mahatā pūjā satkāreṇa mahatīm pūjām kṛtvā sarva nagara dvāreṣu praveśayet vihāre vā grāme vā nagare vā janapade vā nigame vā śmaśāne vā parvate vā araṇya āyatane vā imām aparājitām pratyaṅgirām vidyā rājñī
translated: If there are any human, animal, or cattle plagues, or any calamities, epidemics, troubles, or invasions by foreign armies, one should place the Aparajita Dhvajagrama of the Blessed One, the Victor, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Usnisa of all Tathagatas, on top of a flag, and make great offerings and worship with great honor and respect. One should bring it into all the city gates, or into a monastery, village, town, country, market town, charnel ground, mountain, or forest dwelling. One should bring this Aparajita Pratyangira Vidyarama into all these places with great honor and respect.
As soon as it is brought in, it will bring peace.

analyzed: sarve api upadrava upasarga upāyāsāḥ para cakrāṇi praśāmyanti
translated: All calamities, epidemics, troubles, and foreign armies will be pacified.

original: ananto nāgarājā śaṅkhapālo nāgarājā mahākṛṣṇo nāgarājā nandyupanaṃdau nāgarājānau anye ca sarve te nāgarājānaḥ kāle ca kālaṃ varṣayiṣyanti kālena kālaṃ autsukyamāpatsyate /
analyzed: anantaḥ nāga rājā śaṅkhapālaḥ nāga rājā mahākṛṣṇaḥ nāga rājā nandi upanaṃdau nāga rājānau anye ca sarve te nāga rājānaḥ kāle ca kālam varṣayiṣyanti kālena kālam autsukyam āpatsyate
translated: Ananta, the king of nāgas, Śaṅkhapāla, the king of nāgas, Mahākṛṣṇa, the king of nāgas, Nandyupa-nandau, the kings of nāgas, and all the other kings of nāgas, will rain down at the right time, and will be eager at the right time.

analyzed: kālena kālam garjayiṣyanti sarva roga upadravān ca upaśamayiṣyanti
translated: At the right time, they will roar and will pacify all diseases and calamities.

original: om ṣṭroṃ bandha sarvaduṣṭān rakṣa māṃ sarvasattvāṃśca svāhā /
analyzed: om ṣṭroṃ bandha sarva duṣṭān rakṣa mām sarva sattvān ca svāhā
translated: Om ṣṭhrōṃ bind all evildoers, protect me and all beings, svāhā.

original: om hū ṣṭroṃ bandha duṣṭān rakṣa māṃ sarvasattvāṃśca vajrapāṇe hū phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om hū ṣṭroṃ bandha duṣṭān rakṣa mām sarva sattvān ca vajrapāṇe hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om hū ṣṭhrōṃ bind evildoers, protect me and all beings, vajrapāṇi hū phaṭ svāhā.

analyzed: om sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa avalokita mūrdhni tejaḥ rāśi
translated: Om all tathāgatas ūrṇā on the head of Avalokiteśvara, a mass of light.

original: om jvala dhak khāda dara vidara chinte chinda
analyzed: om jvala dhak khāda dara vidara chinte chinda
translated: Om blaze, strike, eat, tear, split, cut, cut

original: bhinda hū phaṭ rakṣa māṃ sarvasattvāṃśca svāhā /
analyzed: bhinda   phaṭ rakṣa mām sarva sattvān ca svāhā
translated: pierce, hū phaṭ, protect me and all beings, svāhā.

analyzed: om sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatre hū phaṭ
translated: Om all tathāgatas ūrṇā white parasol, hū phaṭ.

original: om rakṣa māṃ sarvasattvāṃśca hū phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om rakṣa mām sarva sattvān ca hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om protect me and all beings, hū phaṭ svāhā.

original: tadyathā om anale khasame vīre saumye sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhite sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣasitātapatre sarvaduṣṭacittān hū phaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā om anale acare khasame vīre saumye sarva buddha adhiṣṭhāna dhiṣṭhite sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatre sarva duṣṭa cittān hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: For example, Om Anale Khasa-me Vīre Saumye Sarva-Buddha-Adhiṣṭhāna-Adhiṣṭhite Sarva-Tathāgata-Uṣṇīṣa-Sitātapatre Sarva-Duṣṭa-Cittān Hū Phaṭ Svāhā.

analyzed: buddha yogena sarva upadraveṣu tri japtā kartavyā
translated: By the yoga of the Buddha, it should be recited three times against all calamities.

analyzed: sarva buddha bodhisattvāḥ ca sa deva mānuṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahā uragaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: The world of all Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and the assembly of gods, humans, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas rejoiced in the Blessed One's teaching.

analyzed: ārya sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa sita ātapatrānām aparājitā pratyaṅgirā
translated: The Noble Aparājitā Prajñāpāramitā, the Uṣṇīṣa of All Tathāgatas, Named the Sita-Atapa-Tra
The Great Vidyā Queen is complete.
